pathAssistantSteps.info:
What to do in this step?

  • Outside SF: in your relevant configured quoting tools: configure the solution to be quoted and add pricing and discounting
  • Create proposal document (proposal) and add it to SF (can be a formal Tender)
  • In SF: Get Epiroc approvals where needed, The approval process triggers on clicking "Mark Stage as Complete" based on currency, amount and leading business line. The record will be LOCKED until approval process ends with either approved or rejected


Sales Gate to go to next step?

  • Gate 4: Approve Proposal to be submitted

What to do in this step?

  • Present proposal (if allowed)
  • Check "competitive advantage"
  • Iterate solution & pricing
  • T&C's (if not done yet)


Sales Gate to go to next step? (only for Managed opportunities)

  • Gate 5: Decision to contract

What to do in this step?

  • Contact Prospect/Customer to understand Opportunity validity
  • Finance (and sanction) checks
  • Qualify the Opportunity (using BANT: Budget available - Authorized decision makers known - Needs clarified - Timeline and buying process clear)
  • Understand detailed needs and add Division/Business Line and high-level Products and our Value Proposition
  • Collaborate to design solution and iteratively refine it

Sales Gate to go to next step?

  • Gate 2: Opportunity Confirmed (i.e. BANT tested)
  • Gate 3: Decision to make a Proposal/Quote (only for Managed Opportunities)
